title: Autonomous Systems Help NASA's Perseverance Do More Science on Mars
summary: A computer pilot helps NASA’s six-wheeled geologist as it searches for rock samples that could be brought to Earth for deeper investigation.

title: ArianeGroup Invests €27M More into MaiaSpace
summary:
As per public filings, ArianeGroup completed a €27 million investment into MaiaSpace on 27 June 2023. Filings indicate that MaiaSpace issued an additional 6.75 million shares as part of the agreement. Having been founded in late 2021, MaiaSpace is working towards the ambitious goal of a 2025 maiden flight of Maia. The vehicle is a […]
The post ArianeGroup Invests €27M More into MaiaSpace appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: The Artemis Accords: Changing the Narrative from Space Race to Space Cooperation

title: China’s Galactic Energy suffers first launch failure
summary: Chinese commercial rocket firm Galactic Energy experienced its first failure Thursday with its 10th launch attempt.

title: FAA proposes rule to limit lifetime of upper stages in orbit
summary: The FAA has proposed new regulations that would require commercial launch providers to dispose of upper stages from their launches to mitigate the growth of orbital debris.
